content: the apple picnic socks were initially created to wear with doc marten boots with a row of apples poking over these socks are knit from the cuff down with a 2x2 ribbed cuff a wrap and turn short row heel and stranded colorwork the toe is finished with kitchener stitch sample the sample was knit with magic loop size 2 sample used approximately 40 g/150 yd base color 24 g/105 yd red 4 g/16 yd brown and 3 g/13 yd green sizing 1 2 3 to fit foot circumference of 8 9 10 5 inches recommended 1 inch of negative ease sample was knit in size 2 materials fingering weight sock yarn sample used cascade yarns heritage sock in limestone valley yarns huntington in sunset dirty water dyeworks lillian in old brown dog and scrap green sock yarn gauge 36 sts x 38 rnds needles for ribbing 2 25 mm/us 1 note 2 5 mm can be used but the cuff will be looser for heel leg and toe 2 5 mm/us 1 5 *note* - this pattern was not tech edited or test knit if you notice any issues with the pattern please feel free to reach out to me so i can correct them thank you
